#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Rakvere

#Text=Rakvere ( Tarbapea in ancient Estonian , Weisenberg in German , Rakowor in Russian ) is Estonia ’s fifth largest city and situated the northern part of the country , 20 km south of the Gulf of Finland and approximately 100 km east of Tallinn , Estonia .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Its earliest signs of human settlement date back to the 3rd-5th century .
#Text=Nowadays , Rakvere is an attractive and rapidly developing town with quite an interesting character .
#Text=The modern Rakvere perfectly reflects the phenomenon of the Estonian province : with visible lowliness and calm , a turbulent cultural life flows here .
#Text=Every day there is a play or a movie in the theatre , there are a lot of cafés and restaurants in the city , and the architecture is diverse and quite original .
#Text=Rakvere is the place where the first Estonian Punk Song Festival took place .

#Text=It ’s also the host to the well-known international rock music festival “ Green Christmas . ” Since 1994 , a biannual international theatre festival , called Baltoscandal has taken place in the unique , friendly and slightly crazy atmosphere of Rakvere .
#Text=The city is also known in Estonia for its youthful hip-hop and electronic music scene .
#Text=So it ’s no wonder , that the motto of Rakvere is “ full of power ” .
#Text=More information : http://rakvere.kovtp.ee/
#Text=Tourist Information Centre , Laada tn 14 , ☏ +3723242734 , fax : +3723242734 , ✉ rakvere@visitestonia.com .
#Text=When closed , a sign on the door suggests to take a look at the printouts of the city maps , posted in the window to the right of the entrance .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Bus and train schedules are easily available online – read more under Estonia#Get around .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Rakvere Bus Station , Laada 18a . 06:45 – 20:00 .
#Text=Modern glass pavilion with benches , cash desks and R-kiosk .
#Text=The schedule is displayed above the ticket offices , so it can be read directly from the street .
#Text=However , it is arranged in a completely mysterious way , contrary to any principles of design and structuring of information .
#Text=Rakvere has regular bus connections to Tallinn ( every hour , 1.5 hr ) , Tartu ( every two hours , 2 hr 10 min ) Narva ( every two hours , 2.5 hr ) , Jõhvi and to a number of other cities .
#Text=By train
#Text=Rakvere Railway Station , Jaama 6a ( 1 km to the north-east of the city centre ) .
#Text=The building of the station is actually a shop , so you might believe that no trains go from here .
#Text=Unfortunately , the original building of the station in Rakvere was not preserved .
#Text=Edelaraudtee runs a Tallinn-Narva train twice a day , which stops in Rakvere , and another train just to Rakvere ( 1 hr 20 min ) .
#Text=With their help you can come to the city in the morning and return to Tallinn in the evening .
#Text=GoRail also operates the Tallinn- Moscow line , which also stops in Rakvere .
#Text=By car
#Text=Rakvere is a short distance from the Tallinn-Narva road and the Rakvere- Pärnu road #5 .
#Text=Tallinn 100 km , Narva 116 km , Tartu 133 km .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The major landmark is the castle and its mountain , which stretches from north to south , along Pikk Street to the west – the most historic part of the city .
#Text=The central square ( Turu plats ) is located in a couple of blocks to the east .
#Text=By foot
#Text=Most attractions of Rakvere are within walking distance .
#Text=The most distant point of interest is the railways station in the north of the city .
#Text=By bus
#Text=The public transport buses are operated by GoBus Rakvere – there is a total of 5 bus lines .
#Text=All of them go at intervals every hour and are unlikely to be useful to the traveler , as the sights are in walking distance .
#Text=See
#Text=" Tarvas " Bull Statue ( Tarva kuju / Wild Herbivore ) , Kreutzwaldi 1 ( located near the old castle ruins ) .
#Text=It ’s considered to be the largest animal statue in the Baltics .
#Text=According to the legend , there was an ox once in the world the size of the distance between Tartu and Rakvere , which destroyed everything in its way .
#Text=One day it was killed , and his head fell down in Rakvere .
#Text=So , the city began to be called Tarbapea ( bull 's head ) , and the rest fell to Tartu , called Tarbatu ( bull ) .
#Text=The attitude of the Tartu inhabitants to this legend is cautiously silent .
#Text=Rakvere 's town square ( Turu plats ) .
#Text=A small square in the centre of Rakvere , and probably the most modern in Estonia .
#Text=It was completely renovated in 2004 , when strange yellow canopies resembling , either umbrellas or lampshades , were installed here .
#Text=In 2010 , the city ​​sculpture " Young man on bicycle listening to music " was added to the umbrellas .
#Text=It is dedicated to the citizen Arvo Pärt , an Estonian composer who grew up in Rakvere .
#Text=Nowadays , daily at noon , his music is played by the Church of the Holy Trinity .
#Text=The symbolism of all these objects is not quite clear .

#Text=When resting under the umbrella , pay attention to the bank building ( Turu plats 2 , 1932-33 ) – a monument of functionalism architecture – as well as the yellow market building ( Laada tn 14 , 1926-28 ) , an example of Art Deco – semicircular arches , numerous tiers with multi-sized windows and a rectangular tower were intertwined .
#Text=All quite fascinating , and the building can easily be taken for the town hall or station , but not for the market , which , however , has not been here for a long time .
#Text=Lutheran Church of the Holy Trinity ( Rakvere Kolmainu kirik ) , Pikk 19 , ☏ +3723243928 , +372 5513771 , ✉ rakvere@eelk.ee .
#Text=This is a late medieval church with an unusually high and slender spire that was built in the 17th century .
#Text=Built at the beginning of the 15th century , the church was a shelter during the Livonian war ( 1558-1583 ) , during which it suffered a lot of damage .
#Text=The nave of the church was even in a state of collapse due to the demolition .
#Text=However , it was reconstructed between 1684-1693 as a three-nave chamber church .
#Text=Between 1703-1708 it was burnt twice , and later rebuilt between 1727-1730 .
#Text=The existing spire of the church was built in 1852 .
#Text=The part made of stones is 37.8 m in height , but the church has a total height of 62 m. The church 's history is related to grave marker of Bishop Arnoldus H. Annabat .
#Text=Eye-catching Baroque fretwork masterpieces – the pulpit and altar wall , can be found inside , besides other art objects .

#Text=Orthodox Church of the Nativity of Theotokos ( Christmas Church / Church of Nativity of the Most Holy Mother of God / Estonian Orthodox Chruch of Moscow Patriarchate / MPEÕK Rakvere Jumalaema Sündimise kirik ) , Tallinna 17 , ☏ +37251921272 . 10:00 – 16:00 .
#Text=The original church was a two-storey building purchased according to an order of the Russian Emperor Nicholas I and the Most Holy Synod in 1839 .
#Text=Parishioners of the church were families of the orthodox merchants , city officials , teachers of the local educational institutions , and soldiers of border guards .
#Text=From the middle of the 19th century the size of the parish was increased by Estonian peasants , who had adopted the Orthodox faith .
#Text=It was completely rebuilt at the beginning of the 20th century .
#Text=Consecration of the temple was done by the Archbishop of Riga and Mitava Agaphangel ( Preobrazhensky ) .
#Text=Nowadays , it looks like a strange , very provincial , rather boring variation of the pseudo-Russian style , but it looks very unusual for the Baltic landscape .

#Text=The interior is modest and mostly wooden , containing the holy remains of the martyred priest Sergei Florinski ( Sergius of Rakvere ) , brought here in 2003 , which are the only public holy remains in Estonia .
#Text=Sergei was a chaplain , who was shot by the order of Estonian Labour Commune in Rakvere on December 30th , 1918 .
#Text=The Church of St. Paul , Võimla tn 1 .
#Text=From a distance this building resembles a workshop .
#Text=In fact , it is a church built in the late 1930s in the style of radical radicalism .
#Text=For obvious reasons , the decoration did not have time to finish : the building is unplastered and the towers were left without completion .
#Text=In Soviet times , the church was converted into a gymnasium , which is located here to this day .
#Text=A more ( 1933 ) can be seen on the next street ( Koidula 15 ) – a pretty wooden building with perfect geometric shapes .
#Text=Rakvere Citizen 's House Museum ( Rakvere Linnakodaniku muuseum ) , Pikk 50 , ☏ +3723244248 . Tu - Sa 11:00 – 17:00 ( until 15:00 in winter ) .
#Text=Museum of folk life , recreating the situation and occupation of the inhabitants of Rakvere in the first half of the 20th century .
#Text=Estonian Police Museum ( Eesti politseimuuseum ) , Tallinna 3 , ☏ +3723225503 . Tu - Sa 10:00 – 18:00 .
#Text=A largely interactive museum , designed to tell visitors about the daily work of police .
#Text=You can check your reaction behind the wheel of a car , take fingerprints , or look at a forensic laboratory .
#Text=For children this will be especially interesting .
#Text=Rodewal Manor , Vahtra allee ( behind the railway station ) .
#Text=A country estate on the edge of Rakvere .
#Text=The wooden manor house was built in 1864 and with interestingly carved decoration of snakes on the pediment .

#Text=Pikk Street – Completely preserved pre-revolutionary buildings , a kind of " assorted " : stone mansions of the Russian type , typical for the Baltic wooden houses and , of course , the ubiquitous brick style .

#Text=Particularly interesting are the one-storey mansion of the 18th century , later designed for modernity ( Pikk 16 ) , a wooden building of optics from 1887 with intricate carvings ( Pikk 17 ) , and a wooden dwelling house of the late 18th century ( Pikk 21 ) .
#Text=Wooden architecture – In addition to the various houses of the 19th century – more interesting from the ethnographic point of view – there are very nice buildings in the spirit of Art Deco .

#Text=This includes the county government ( Fr . R. Kreutzwaldi 5 , opposite the theatre ) , the apartment houses Koidula 4 and Adoffi 3 near the central square ( Kastani 17 ) , and the kindergarten ( Koidula 14 ) .
#Text=These houses were built during the inter-war period .

#Text=Pre-revolutionary stone architecture – Represented by the dark red building of the court ( Tallinna tn 3 , 1786-87 ) , where the exhibition house is now located , and the neighbouring manor house ( Tallinna tn 5 ) , in which the city administration is located .
#Text=Go to the arch and into the yard – there are still some manor buildings of a completely German type .
#Text=Another more monumental courthouse can be found at Lai 6 , built at the end of the 19th century .
